bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Historic Neighborhood Consortium (PHNC) is a group of more than 40 cultural institutions, museums, historic houses of worship and historic sites located within walking distance of the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall. Its members include the American Philosophical Society, the African American Museum in Philadelphia, the Chemical Heritage Foundation, and the National Constitution Center.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Philadelphia Historical Neighborhood Consortium. Materials include: by-laws and articles of incorporation; financial information, including bank statements, paid bills, and dues; meeting minutes, agendas, and correspondence between PHNC members; documentation of projects and activities including concerts, open houses, and production of a video guide to member institutions; newsletters, brochures, and flyers; and clippings and press releases.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
